intro: Smilacina hirta, commonly known as hairy greenbriar, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Smilacaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Smilacina hirta thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
